physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Lung examination showed no abnormalities, and no lymphadenopathy was appreciated.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Normal white blood cell count of 9.6.
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Patient exhibited decreased energy, anorexia, and pleuritic chest pain.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially diagnosed with presumed pneumonia, treatment with antibiotics did not improve symptoms; repeat imaging showed an enlarging mass, leading to surgical intervention.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Left muscle-sparing thoracotomy revealed a 4-cm firm mass in the left upper lobe.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Post-surgery, the patient had an uneventful recovery.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: No evidence of recurrent tumor on CT.
